City Council

About City Government

The City of Shenandoah is a General Law city with a population of approximately 4,000 people. Shenandoah has a council-manager form of government which consists of an elected City Council of five members and a Mayor that is responsible for policymaking. The City also has a city administrator, appointed by the Council, who is responsible for administration. The council-manager form, the most popular form of government, is based on the model of a business with a board of directors that appoints a chief executive officer. The Council members have different backgrounds and a range of experiences, but they share the common goal of achieving the best interests of the City and its residents and businesses.

  • 2nd and 4th Wednesday of every month
  • City Hall Council Chambers
